column1: very full and a Mustafiz finds a hint of inswing, finishes on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
good length and holds its line on middle, blocked towards mid-on
full and on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, no shot
leg-stump half-volley with a label: 'help yourself'. Elgar does that, neatly flicking off the pads to the square-leg boundary
dug in shorter and wider outside off now, Elgar shoulders arms
full and angling in on middle, bunted to the off side
slides a very full, very wide ball as greeting to Markram who ignores it
looks for the blockhole, Markram digs it out
a grunt of effort as he pitches a good length ball outside off. The right-hander lets it go again
massive appeal for lbw, Roy excited by a little bit of movement into the batsman. But Markram has inside edged it onto his pad and umpire Oxenford spots it easily enough
teasing line just outside off - at 132 kph - Markram thinks about playing but then avoids it
protects middle stump against a 132 kph good length ball
blocks a length ball on off stump with an open face. Mustafiz pulls up in his followthrough, perhaps feeling a twinge in his leg
too full on leg stump, but Elgar's flick finds short midwicket
goes for the bouncer, at 133 kph, and a straight one at that. Elgar evades it
back of a length and outside off, Elgar lets it go
leg-stump half-volley and Elgar flicks it away to the fine leg boundary. Minimum effort.
pushes him back with a short ball at 136, Elgar rises with it and defends well
Roy serves up a low full-toss outside off, Markram presses forward and drives it serenely through square point. Three boundaries in four overs
dug in short and outside off, 137ks, the batsman gets on top of the bounce and punches to cover
back of a length and holds its line outside off, ignored
Markram rises on top of a short ball outside off and punches it through the gap at cover for three
another half-volley, this is floated outside off, Elgar simply leans into it and caresses a drive straight of mid-off
overpitched on middle, Elgar closes the face and drives straight of mid-on now. Five boundaries in four overs for SA. That four takes Elgar to 1000 Test runs this year
back of a length and angling in on middle from over the wicket, Markram shuffles across and defensively nudges the ball to the leg side
low full-toss, swerves into leg stump, dug back down the pitch
on a length and dangled up wide outside off, a crease-bound Markram slashes at a drive in the channel... and misses. The back foot is on the move as he plays the shot
pitched up and outside off, tighter from Markram, as he lets it pass
shorter and outside off, 137ks, the ball hits the splice. Blocked in front of cover
good length and zipping through outside off, Markram leaves it be
floated on a length on the pads, turned to midwicket
121ks gentle inswinger, Elgar presses forward, reads the movement in the air, and nudges to short midwicket
full and straight on middle, Elgar opens the face and plays with soft hands to the cordon
lobbed up full on the off stump, Elgar drives it right back to Sarkar
full and angling away just a shade outside off, Elgar drives it straight to mid-on
pitched up and outside off, 121.7ks, Elgar stretches forward and eases a drive through mid-off. Make it six boundaries in six overs
good length and holds its line outside off, Markram does not go after it
back of a length and angling in at middle stump, patted to the left of mid-on for one
skiddy full ball on middle, Elgar jabs his bat down hastily and pokes an outside edge that wanders away to point
back of a length on the leg stump, worked away to forward short leg off the back foot
shortish and angling away outside off, Elgar gets on top of the bounce and times it handsomely through cover. First scoring shot for Elgar other than a boundary this morning
Rubel runs in hard, hits the deck harder. But Elgar easily evades this 138ks bouncer
full and angling away outside off, Markram simply watches it through to the keeper
back of a length and slanting away further, ignored in the channel
back of a length and angling away outside off, ignored again. Got to get closer to off to make him play
too wide outside off again, left alone
full and holds its line outside off, no shot
too full and wide outside off, despite the change of angle, that rounds out an over of leaves
short and angling away outside off, dabbed to point
good length and jagging away outside off, no shot again
shot! Overpitched and outside off, Elgar crisply hits through the line. He punchily drives it to the left of mid-off. His driving has been delightful
banged in short on the leg stump, cramping Elgar for room. The batsman jumps off the ground and fends it away wide of short leg
back of a length and outside off, Markram stabs at it and thickly edges it in front of gully
back of a length on a fifth-stump line, Markram hoists his bat above his shoulder and lets it go
full and swerves back in after starting outside off from over the wicket, defended to the leg side
banged in short on off, Elgar rises with this rising delivery and pats it down square on the off side
shortish on the leg stump, turned away to square leg
shorter and outside off, Elgar gets on top of it and fends it off to backward point
menacing bouncer outside off, Elgar is up to the challenge. He watches it carefully before swaying his upper body out of the way
Mustafiz bangs it short, think it's the cutter, Elgar plays early and drops a leading edge in front of the bowler
back of a length and angling in on middle, run back down the pitch
pitched up and angling into a forward-defensive back to the bowler
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Markram hangs back and pats it to cover
back of a length and wider outside off, Markram uses the width and punches it nicely through cover-point for a double
back of a length and skidding into off stump, blocked to the leg side off the back foot
Bangladesh's are bowlers spraying the ball all around the shop. This is darted short and really wide outside off. Markram extends his hands and flays it away to the cover boundary. Dismissive
short and angling into the body, fended off to short leg
slower cutter, short and outside off, this is more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull. Dragged over midwicket
full and angling away outside off, no shot
short and rising outside off, Markram jumps off the ground and fends it off to point with soft hands
good length and nibbling away outside off - much closer to off - squares up Markram and whistles past the outside edge
banged in short on middle, fended in front of short midwicket
good length and angling away outside off, 140ks, Elgar isn't too perturbed. Driven in the gap between point and cover
Rubel hurls a bouncer on the leg stump, Elgar ducks under it with no fuss
shortish and outside off - sits up to be hit - Elgar swivels back and pulls it in the air over midwicket. Another loose ball - this one undoes Mustafiz's good work in the previous over
very full on middle, played back down the pitch. The bowler can't gather it cleanly
not a half-volley outside off, good length in the channel, driven through the line. This stroke through mid-off brings up the fifty opening stand
good length on a fourth-stump line, tightly defended to cover
shortish and slanting in on middle, patted to mid-on
back of a length and holds its line wide outside off, Elgar stands up tall and handsomely punches to the right of a tumbling backward point (Mahmudullah)
short and skiddy outside off, the Fizz cranks up to 138ks, played to point
banged in short and flies through to the keeper outside off, Elgar has nothing to do with it
short and wide outside off, angling away further, cracked straight to backward point
dug in short on the leg stump, tucks 'em up for room. Elgar is caught in a tangle. The ball glances the glove on its way to the keeper
pitched up and outside off, barely 130ks, Markram shelves the drive and lets it go
tight line on off, defended back to Roy
back of a length and angling in on middle, turned to midwicket
full and nibbling away slightly outside off, a crease-bound Elgar squirts an inside edge onto the pad
full on middle, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
tossed up, full on middle, blocked to short leg off the front foot
low full-toss on middle, slapped back down the pitch
flighted on middle, blocked to short leg again
Taijul throws this up on middle stump, he errs too full, Markram belts it straight of mid-on. Bam!
sliding just a shade outside off, defended back to the bowler
tossed on off, defended off the front foot
short and climbing on an off stump, leaps and drops it into the midwicket region
good length at off stump, defended from the crease
back of a length at off stump, comfortably on top of the bounce to punch to cover
good length at off and middle, shovelled to deep midwicket
bouncer on middle stump, too short. Easily ducks it
close. This dips back in at Elgar from the corridor. He's looking to leave it on angle, but this keeps coming back in
good length,off stump, defended on the back foot
full on off stump, defended into the leg side
good length, dipping at middle stump. Short stride as he pokes at this and gets an inside edge. Short fine chases
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full and floated in at the toes, tickled fine
good length, pushed at off stump. Defended into the off side
good length, slight shape away in the corridor. Defended off the outside half, short stride
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, whipped off the front foot to deep square. Off the toe-end with a turning bat
good length at off stump, angled bat to tap this on the up, to mid-on's left
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short one at middle stump, nicely in control this time - on top of he bounce, brings the bat down with good timing and rolls the wrists to bisect deep square and fine leg
good length at off stump, leans in nicely and drives it wide of mid-off. Wasn't to the pitch of this, but the surface is great
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, punched to deep mid-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full at leg stump, uses the angle to tap this to short midwicket
tossed up at off stump, driven to short mid-off. Who shies and hits the striker's stumps. They don't take a run on the ricochet
sweet. Good length, just outside off. All timing this - leans in and opens the face at the last moment, sends it through the covers and into the boundary to bring up his fifth Test fifty of the year
good length at off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
good length at middle stump, pushed off the middle of the bat to mid-on
overpitched on middle stump and a crisp drive back down the pitch. Bowlers gets down to stop it
bouncer, very short. Ducked easily
well bowled. Gets the right length on the short one this time, slants it across the batsman at chest height in the corridor. Elgar drops his wrists and lets it go
tossed up outside off, driven back at the bowler
good length on off stump, defended into the off side
shot. Jumps down the track and reaches the pitch of of this outside off, and then uses his wrists to thump it wide of mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
good length, middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
pushed through short and outside off, left alone
short one at the ribs, watchfully tucked behind square with soft hands
back of a length in the corridor, pushed on the up to midwicket's left
good length outside off, opens the face and pokes it through point
back of a length at middle stump, tucked past midwicket off the back foot

back of a length outside off, 128 kph, comes on nicely. No movement whatsoever. He just has to transfer his weight back and get this in the gap. Leaps off the ground to do that and punch through cover point
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
good length and angled away from off stump from around the wicket, reaches out and dabs it past slip off the outer half
good length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed wide of mid-off from the back foot
good length at off stump, defended with an open face
good length outside off, looks to drive, gets it down the pitch off the inside half
slightly short, slight width offered. Nothing menacing about that. On the back foot and punched to the cover boundary
back of a length in the corridor, dabbed to gully
good length outside off stump, pushed to deep point off the outside of the bat
back of a length, 138 kph, and slight tail in towards the batsman who doesn't time this. Turning bat, shovelled to midwicket
back of a length outside off, mistimed chop into the off side, gets it enough to cover's left to steal the single
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven back at the bowler who parries it to mid-off
good length at off stump, shuffles to poke this into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
tossed up outside off, driven straight to extra cover
floated up, full and wide outside off. He won't let go of that on most days. Today, it's even simpler. Driven firmly to the extra cover boundary
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide, slapped away to deep point...where it is the captain fielding
good length at middle stump, checks his attempted flick and opens the face to get this to mid-off. Some late movement away there
overpitched outside off stump, watches it very late to open the face on the drive and beat deep point to his left
attempted bouncer, comfortably ducked as it climbs over leg stump
another attempted bouncer, too short, too far down leg side
back of a length at middle stump, flicked off his waist to square leg

wide of the crease, angled in at leg stump, back of a length...and wow, he's punched that for four. It didn't look like he was looking for a boundary. Caressed past mid-on who is an awkward figure running to his right
full toss at off stump, driven firmly, straight to short mid-off
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
oh, gorgeous. The third time he's found that gap wide of mid-on in two overs. Steps out this time, picks it off a length outside off and drives neatly to bring up his fifty
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
length, off stump, forward block
back of a length outside off stump, opens the face and taps it to deep point
back of a length outside off, watchfully dabbed late to get it to deep point's left...where Mushfiqur is still positioned
full and outside off stump, bit of shape in, left alone
back of a length outside off, poked through point with soft hands
bouncer, too short, ducked
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot...and he's off before the umpires even call lunch
tossed on off, defended back to the bowler
full-toss on middle, swatted away wide of midwicket
skidding into the pads from over the wicket, nudged to square leg for one
dangled up outside off, driven through the line to mid-off off the front foot
full and straight, tucked away to deep midwicket
dropped short and wide outside off, Markram ventures deep in the crease and punches a single to the cover-point sweeper
back of a length and angling away outside off, run away to deep point
short and width outside off, carved away to the off-side sweeper
overpitched on middle, Markram brings his wrists into play and drives it serenely between midwicket and mid-on
full and angling across off, no shot
short and holds its line outside off, punched back to the bowler
full and in the channel outside off, no shot
dangled up outside off, Elgar opens the face and dabs a single to cover-point
looped up on off, driven down the ground to mid-off
friendly full-toss outside off, which is lashed away to the left of mid-off
shorter and flatter outside off, no turn, cracked to the off-side sweeper off the back foot
slower through the air, starts outside off and breaks in, played back down the pitch
clipped with the turn to deep midwicket
short and outside off, Elgar rides the bounce and guides it between cover and backward point
back of a length, blocked on off
back of a length and angling in on off, turned away past the right of mid-on
Mustafiz bangs a bouncer on middle, Elgar pulls out of a hook. The ball flies over a leaping Liton. Too high, and the ball reaches the boundary for five wides
short and darted outside off, Elgar lets it pass too
back of a length and around off, Elgar opens the face and plays with soft hands to gully
hurled short at the chest from around the wicket, cramps Elgar for room. He hops and fends it tentatively to the leg side
flighted and angled in on middle, blocked quietly to short midwicket
short on off, stabbed back down the pitch
Markram hares down the track, the bowler spots it and drags his length back just a shade outside off. Pushed to cover
tossed up on middle, blocked back to the bowler
shorter and drifts in the air on off, jabbed away to backward point off the back foot
follows the good delivery with a rubbish ball: short, wide, four. Markram goes deep in the crease and cuts it powerfully to the right of backward point. Markram takes SA past 150
sliding into the pads, glanced away to long leg
half-volley outside off, Markram stretches out and drives it in the air between mid-off and cover. Uppish but effective
wide half-volley, Markram lays into it, creaming a drive through cover-point now. He overtakes his opening partner
back of a length and slanted in on off, played back to the bowler

good length and slanting away outside off, Markram feels for it in the channel and edges it... but it falls short of Kayes at slip. Awkward bounce means Kayes cops a blow on his knee/thigh. He needs medical attention. Bangladesh can't afford another injury. Kayes hobbles off the field
back of a length and angling away outside off, Markram stands tall, stabs at it, and inside-edges it back to the bowler
full and slanting away around off, poked back down the pitch to mid-off
floated full and outside off, Elgar leans into a drive and sends the ball to the right of mid-off
back of a length and kicks up on off, whipped away to deep midwicket
good length on a fourth-stump line, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
good length and bounces outside off, grazes the outside edge but does not carry to second slip
Markram rises on top of a short ball outside off and punches it nicely to deep point
full and angling away outside off, seam-up, tapped to point off the front foot
back of a length on the leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
hip-high short ball outside off, Elgar adjusts and shovels it away to the left of mid-on and to the right of deep midwicket
attempted short ball on middle, keeps low, Markaram toe-ends it to the leg side
dragged short and wide outside off - sits up to be hit - Elgar fetches it from there and shovel-pulls it past the left of mid-on
bouncer just outside leg, Elgar evades it
floated very full and outside off, ignored
back of a length and too straight in line, punched with the wrists to the right of mid-on for another boundary
shorter and just a shade outside off, Markram jumps off the ground and forces the ball to cover
back of a length and angling into a back-foot defensive on off
full and holds its line outside off, no shot
good length and angled in on middle, that's tapped away to mid-on
slid through outside off, defended tentatively onto the pitch
nudged with the break to deep square leg
tossed outside off and spins in - of the slow variety - driven with the break to long-on
dangled up full and outside off, stabbed back to Taijul
non-turning length ball on a fourth-stump line, blocked off the front foot
arm ball, slides in on middle, blocked to the leg side
pitched up and outside off, patted down to mid-off
short and wide outside off, cracked to backward point
full and floats through outside off, no shot
shortish on middle, bunted wide of short midwicket for one. Elgar is the first one into the nineties
back of a length and straight in line, easily tucked away to fine leg
overpitched and outside off, Elgar pounces onto it. He springs forward and drives a drive straight of mid-off. Delectable
drifts in on middle, nudged to square leg. Markram joins his partner in the nineties
pushed through outside off and spins in, Elgar sits back and clips away with the break through backward square leg

Elgar brings up his second hundred in two Tests and tenth overall. Dangled up and outside off. A bit too full, Elgar leans into it and caresses a drive through the covers. He leaps, punches the air, and swipes his bat to celebrate the landmark. He continues to pile on the runs in 2017
flighted on a fourth-stump line, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
clipped with the turn to deep midwicket
back of a length and angling away outside off, eased through point
on a length and just outside off, Markram jabs the ball away to cover
pitched up on off, forward and driven back to the bowler
short and outside off, Markram rises on top of it and punches it away to the left of cover. The double brings up the 200-run stand
full and sliding down leg, Markram can't glance it fine
back of a length and outside off, chopped away through cover-point
full offbreak on off, clipped to midwicket
really full on off, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, bunted to cover off the front foot
darted on the leg stump, whipped to backward square leg
short offbreak, finishes on off, whipped with the turn to mid-on
back of a length on middle, clipped away to backward square leg again
back of a length at off stump, defended into the pitch
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
full toss outside off, careful as he looks to get bat on it. An unconvincing tap in the end. Gets it to mid-off's right
good length, wide outside off stump. Short stride as he stabs at this on the up and opens the face to get it to the backward point fence
is that it? Yes it is! First Test century for Markram. Short one into his body, climbs on top of the bounce and swats it between deep square and fine leg
good length, zipping in at middle stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
full and down leg side, misses as he looks to flick
good length, into the pads. Tapped into the square leg region
good length, pushed through flat at off stump, tapped back down the pitch
good length, in at middle stump, defended down the pitch
good length, off stump, blocked
good length, in at leg stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length outside off, looks to slice it square, under-edges into the pitch
good length at off stump, pushed down the pitch, into the stumps
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
short and wide outside off stump, looks to cut, gets it off the toe end
outside edge flies over wide gully. This was short and wide outside off, he got slightly under it and it got slightly big on him as he went for the cut. Not in control
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
full at off stump, driven to long-off
full at off stump, pushed back towards the bowler
back of a length at leg stump, nudged to deep midwicket off the back foot
full at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
overpitched outside off stump, check-drive to extra cover
good length, in at off stump, defended from the crease
good length, in at leg stump. Uppish clip off the pads to deep square
offcutter, back of a length at off stump. Closes the face as he defends this
full outside off stump, doesn't connect too well on the drive. Extra cover leaps to his right and parries this behind mid-off who was running to his left
bouncer at his chest, he looks to avoid it and cops it on the front bicep. It trickles towards fine leg
back of a length at off stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
good length, middle stump, poked into the leg side
back of a length into the pads, can't get on it as he looks to glance
good length outside off, skewed to point off the front foot

third umpire review for stumping. This was fired down leg, Markram misses the flick and Liton collected to whip the bails off. Markram was falling over slightly, and that appeared to make the foot rise - but replays show it was firmly planted. Not out.
back of a length at middle stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
yorker at leg stump, dug out into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, dabbed to gully from the crease
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot into the leg side
good length, angled across the left-hander who drops it pitch side with soft hands and steals a single
full at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
offcutter, jumps at Markram from a length. Deflected to deep point off the outside half of the bat

dropped. A bouncer from around the wicket. Elgar takes on the hook and is cramped. It's an unconvincing half-swipe in the end and it lobs off his glove. Climbing over the wicket who leaps and tips it upwards, but even the slip, sweeping up behind him, can't get to that with a leap to his right
short at leg stump, deep in the crease to swat this to mid-on's right
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
tossed up harmlessly on leg stump, gets to the pitch and flicks this firmly between mid-on and midwicket
looks like a carrom ball. Back of a length, into middle stump, tapped to mid-on on the up
offcutter, good length at middle stump. Punched back at the bowler who parries it to mid-on
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it and watches it sail after thinking about the hook
falls short of mid-on. bouncer, angling wide of off stump. Looks to drag it from out there with a pull. No attempt to keep it down, but no timing either. He's saved by it
bouncer at the rib cage, controls the pull, keeps it down. Hits it to backward square leg
short one, angled across the corridor, left alone
bouncer, too short, comfortably ducked
full at middle stump, drilled to long-on
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short and outisde off, cuts it square and beats sweeper's dive to his left
good length at off stump, pushed into the covers
good length, off stump, flicked to midwicket
full outside off stump, can't beat extra cover's dive as he drives this on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, pushes it in front of backward square...mix-up, but they go through and safely finish run
short one outside off, comes off slowly from the pitch and he adjusts nicely not to chop this on. Watchfully taps to midwicket
back of a length outside off, pulled to midwicket

taken at fine leg. Elgar started to lose his concentration against the short one last over. And Markram showed how difficult it was to get the pull shot away just one ball ago. Still, he takes this short one on with a pul. It's a top-edge that dips on fine leg who does well to watch it closely and hold on
back of a length at off stump, climbs on top of the bounce and defends into the off side
short one outside off, takes on the pull and skews it over miwicket
full at off stump, driven to mid-off who is quite deep
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
good length, in the corridor, pushed through point with an open face

takes on the short ball. Again. Top edge this time. This was angling down leg side and chased. The edge flies fine and the fielder sprints a long way to his right and puts in a slide to save the boundary. Mominul there
short one, in at leg stump, goes for the pull again. It comes off slowly from the pitch again. This one can't go past the keeper on the leg side

and again. Quite strange stuff from South Africa in the last 15 minutes or so. Another short one at middle stump, goes for the hook and checks his shot at the last moment. Top edge lands short of fine leg
short one at leg stump, pulls from way in front of his body and rolls his wrists to get it towards the square leg boundary...where Taijul lets one through him
top-edge on the pull. Short one on leg stump, bunts at it again. This one lands in front of fine leg too

review for lbw. Pad and bat very close together as he looks to defend outside off stump. Original decision is not out. Looked like he was struck outside the line to me. There were two sounds too. It flew to mid-off....replays show pad first. But the impact is outside the line and the decision will stand. Bangladesh lose a review
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
full at off stump, slight shape in. Defended solidly to mid-off
bouncer, angled down leg side. He lets it go.
dug in short on middle, chest-high ball, pulled away to backward square leg
short and down the leg side, forcefully swatted away to deep square leg. There's also a man at deep midwicket and long leg. Expect plenty of short stuff
lifter outside off, Amla ducks and gets his gloves out of the way

Amla stands up tall to this short ball outside off and punches it crisply to the right of sweeper cover. Taijul's right leg touches the boundary as he looks to scoop the ball back into the field of play. The result is another boundary
inducker from Rubel from a back of a length. Seams back in and nearly chops him into half. Amla had managed an inside edge onto it
bouncer on middle, flies through to Liton as the batsman ducks under it
back of a length and outside off, timed crisply to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, Markram rises on top of the bounce and scythes a cut to deep point
full and angling into a forward-defensive to mid-on
leg-stump half-volley, Amla uses his wrists and merrily picks it off to the midwicket boundary. Easy peasy
short and on a fourth-stump line, sweetly punched past the right of mid-off. Well played, Amla
dug in short and outside off, Markram rocks back and slams a pull wide enough of deep midwicket for a boundary. That pinged off the bat to the fence
bouncer outside off, Amla avoids it and lets it fly through to the keeper
back of a length and outside off, Amla gloriously punches it in the gap at cover
short on off stump, Markram rolls his wrists and swats a pull to backward square leg. He isn't shying away from the short stuff

After pushing Markram back with a volley of short balls, he floors the middle stump with a very full inswinger. The opener, however, walks back to a rousing reception. Rubel spears it in at 140.2ks and storms through the defences of a crease-bound Markram. Genuine wicket-taking delivery from Rubel. Bangladesh need more of these
full and straight, glanced away to long leg
bouncer, angled in, Amla has his eyes locked on the ball before swaying his upper body out of the way
floated full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - no shot

bouncer, angling away outside off, 136.2ks, Sarkar thought about a hook before belatedly bailing out
good length and angling away, Sarkar is halfway forward as he prods it to backward point
short on a length on middle, fended to the left of Markram at short leg
bouncer, angling away, thuds into the gloves of de Kock as Kayes arches back and leaves
short and angling away outside off, Kayes hops, skips, and fends to point
back of a length and angling away outside off, patted to backward point
banged down the leg side, Kayes chases it with a pull and misses
Oliver hits the splice of the bat. Short and slammed into the middle of the deck. Fended on the bounce to Markram at short leg
good length and angling away around off, 141ks, defended back down the pitch
full and angling away outside off, 142.4ks, Sarkar scoops a drive to cover as the bat turns in his hands
short and aimed at the top of off, 142.1ks, Sarkar stops it in its tracks

Sarkar has been bowled around the legs. Sarkar has been pushed back by a volley of short balls. He sits back, then shuffles across, to this good length ball. He plays all around it, and watches it hit the leg stump
speared short on off, Mominul stands up and taps it down
short and zipping away outside off, sharp pace and bounce, Mominul drops his gloves. That rounds out a wicket maiden
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on with a full face
back of a length at middle stump, late on the defence but he digs it into the pitch. Short leg dives to his left
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
bouncer, slanted across off stump. Good technique as he sways out of the line
short one at the ribs and he leaps to flick this aerially towards long leg
short one, climbs outside leg stump. He gets his bat out of the way, high, as he lets it go

oh yes. Top class fast bowling and a good leave too. Short one, climbs steeply in the corridor. He realises he can't get bat on this quickly despite leaping to try and get on top of it. Drops his gloves and watches it go
outside edge rolls through the gully region. Back of a length, in the corridor. Soft hands as he looks to defend. Thick outside edge
and is in action straight away. Good length, angling across in the corridor. Soft-handed prod again and the outside edge lands short of gully to his right
back of a length, wider outside off, and he looks to pull this. Can't connect
good length at middle stump, solidly defended from the crease
short at middle stump, climbs slowly off the pitch and gives him plenty of time to swivel and slap this to the square leg boundary
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and down leg side, left alone
short and wide outside off stump, easily tapped to the cover boundary

is that a glove? Yes! Gets this to climb at his ribs, at a leg stump line. He fends at it, unlike the couple of leaves so far down leg side. It's too quick for him, and his jump isn't enough to help him. Tickled to de Kock
nasty one first up. Lifts steeply from a short length and climbs at his helmet. But he's quick to duck this
pushed wide of the cordon with some control. Sits on the back foot, waits for this at an off stump line and dabs it into that empty region
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
133 kph, back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
good length, sliding into leg stump. Can't get bat as he looks to flick, but it deflects wide of the keeper on the leg side off the pad
back of a length, in at leg stump. Thuds into his thigh guard
good length at off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
wide of the crease, but gets it to dart away from a short length. IT's wide outside off and he's nowhere near quick enough to pull this. Retreats
good length, angled in at off stump. Looks to drive through the off side but he's late on it. Skews  it past the bowler off the inside half and the outfield takes it away
and this one flies through where leg gully was. Back of a length on leg stump, no control as he whips this to fine leg
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, nips away from the pitch and he follows it with his hands. Well away from the body. Poked to point

he's taken it! Bavuma has actually pulled this off at gully! I don't think he can believe it either. Back of a length outside off stump, stabs away from the body again and this time it flies off the face of the bat to Bavuma's right. He picks this up slightly late and therefore has to go with one hand. It's behind him when he pouches it and then tumbles to adjust for the momentum and hold on. He stares at the ball, then at the cordon, then at the ball - all this in no time. Stunning.
back of a length at off stump, poked into the point region off the back foot
full and angled in at off stump, pushes it back down the pitch with no feet
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch from the crease
back of a length at middle stump, exposes the stumps as he looks to whip this into the leg side. Just manages to get a toe on it and get it to deep square
bouncer at the throat, awkwardly fends it away into the leg side. That caught him flush on the left shoulder
back of a length at leg stump, and he anxiously defends this into the leg side with no feet
good length, in at middle and leg. Watchfully pushed wide of short leg
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the outside half
wide of the crease, back of a length in the corridor. Tapped against the angle, into the leg side
short at leg stump, stays put in the crease and ramps this fine with a hook he never wanted to keep down
another short one at leg stump, climbs on top of the bounce and tickles it fine. Can't beat de Kock
takes on the hook and hits it in the air again, but this one bisects fine leg and deep square. Wasn't in control as this hurried him at chest-height
bouncer angled across off stump, ducks and sways this time
overpitched and wide outside off stump. Easy to put that away, and he does. Not a lot of feet though. He reaches away from his body and sliced it through point

he's gone next ball! Oh they keep chasing away from the body. Nicks through to de Kock. Back of a length, wide outside off stump. It's not a cut, and certainly isn't a drive off the back foot. Feels for it and it's easy for the keeper. Says no to the review as he walks past Kayes
good length, angled across off stump. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
short and wide outside off stump, left alone, and it doesn't carry through properly
tossed up at off stump, flicked to mid-on
full at middle stump, late on the forward press. Inside edge rolls past short leg
full at middle stump, pushed down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length, off stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at leg stump, nicely on top of the bounce to poke this through square leg
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
good length in the corridor, defended to mid-off
outside edge flies over Elgar at third slip. Wide length ball outside off stump, chases it and gets an edge that's too quick for Elgar's leap
good length, angled away but he's closer to it this time with a stride and punches to the long-off boundary
back of  a length, slanted away from the corridor. Hangs his bat out again and gets a thick outside edge that runs past gully and point
good  length, off stump, defended into the pitch from the crease
short and just outside off stump, sways away and lets it go

outside edge, taken by de Kock. Low to his left as this dips on him. Good catch. And you don't have to take a guess at how the ball got there. Back of a length ball, wide outside off stump and it's a slashing bat at it, away from his body.
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off, half-stride as he taps this to extra cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
full at off stump, mistimes the attempted drive, down the pitch
full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
back of a length, angled across off stump, left alone
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
oh good shot. Back of a length  and angled into the corridor, but he leaps to punch this past point
bouncer jams this thumb as it climbs towards his throat. He was taking his bottom hand off with bat hanging high as this struck him
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers

chips it straight to extra cover. Full ball, tempts him outside off stump. Might have been slight shape away too. He goes after it with a drive and bunts it off the bottom of the bat, straight to Parnell
back of a length, speared in towards leg stump. Batsman is trying to avoid this, but he's going towards the line of the ball. Pings off his pad to gully. Not out. Not reviewed.
yorker, angled down leg side. Batsman jumps into the off stump this time, but exposes his stumps and just gets away
full and angled into the toes, flicked uppishly to fine leg
back of a length at off stump, dances deep into the crease to defend into the off side
short and wide outside off, pokes his bat out and gets an under-edge that lands in front of de Kock
back of a length in the corridor, dabbed to third slip
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
short and wide outside off stump, hangs his bat out but too slow to get a connection on it, beaten
good length, wide outside off stump. Dies after pitching, rolls through to de Kock
nicely played. Full and angled in at middle stump, flicked straight to wide mid-on
great shot. This short one sits in the pitch and allows him some time. Great balance and he watches it onto the bat as he hooks and keeps it down
good length outside off stump, left alone
takes on the bouncer again, but late on this. Beaten as this flies over his head
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it
back of a length at middle stump, flicks this on the up in front of square and comes back for the second
good length, wide outside off. Takes it on with a drive and slices it uppishly, but even Bavuma can't hold onto this at slip
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-on's right
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
back of a length at middle stump, traps him on the pad as he looks to poke in front of his body. But there where two sounds and he was backing away. Not out decision not reviewed

good length, angled down leg side. Deflects it fine off the pad...and they've decided to review this. Looked like it struck him outside leg at first glance....yes, poor review. No bat on it, but struck him outside leg and missing by a long way. Impact was umpire's call, wickets missing.
back of a length, into the body. Takes his bottom hand off as this climbs on him awkwardly. Gets it to deep square off the inside edge
full and into the toes. Flicks it uppishly but beats leg gully's dive to his right
lovely shot. Good length, outside off stump. Leans into it and punches on the up through the covers
bouncer at middle stump, nicely on top of it to defend this
back of a length outside off, weight moves backwards this time and he's in great position to punch this to the cover boundary
yorker at leg stump, looks to flick it and hits it aerially...Markram sticks out his leg at short leg and stops this with his body the way a certain David De Gea does
good length, swinging away from off stump. Thick outside edge to gully as he pokes at this
full and swinging away from off stump, poked to extra cover
short and wide outside off stump, reaches out and bunts it through point
good length, wide outside off stump, left alone
good length at off stump, defended late. Deflects towards the slip cordon
overpitched outside off stump, leans into it and it's another good looking drive past extra cover
good length, well down leg side. Left alone
back of a length at leg stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and down leg side, no connection as he looks to flick. Appeals from behind the wicket, but no review after they're turned down
beats the outside edge. Back of a length and away from the off stump, pokes at it with no feet
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
bunts it wide of short leg. Short one climbs at his ribs and he manages to poke this to short leg's left. It was in the air...
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, wide outside off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, pushed to sweeper cover on the up
angles it across off stump, back of a length. He pushes at it and it's in the air, but there's no backward point to grab that
short one, angled across off stump, left alone
bouncer, angled across the corridor, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, chops it to deep backward point
length at leg stump, flicked past leg gully
back of a length at off stump, defended through point
bouncer in the corridor, fizzes past the outside edge as he retreats from the shot
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
short and slanted across from off stump, backs away and looks to upper cut. Beaten
good length, shaping away from off stump, left alone
full, swinging away from off stump, left alone
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, closes the face and taps it wide of mid-on
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, swinging away from outside off stump. Fishes at it as it climbs on him. Beaten on the outside edge
full, swinging away from the corridor. No feet as he pushes at this. Beaten
good length, shaping away from off stump. Backs away, exposes his stumps and pokes this past backward point
length at middle stump, turned to deep square on the up
good length, wide outside off stump. Chases it, and can't get bat
back of a length, angled away from off stump. Defended down the pitch off the back foot
short and angled away from off stump. Nearly chops this onto off stump as he looks to cut. But he's been by far the luckiest batsman today. And why not, after that clubbing in the field?
good length, swinging away. Left alone
good length, shape away, but comfortably defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, stands tall and whips this off the front foot, past mid-on. Very stylish from him today
good length, swings away from middle stump. Squares him up a tad as he taps this down the pitch
back of a length outside off, tapped through the covers to bring up his fifty
dipping in, full at leg stump. Flicks it to fine leg
good length and angling in at off, played back to the bowler

Nip-backer from Olivier. He bursts through the gate of Taijul. Back of a length, angling in, curving in sharply from around the wicket. Taijul dares to drive with a big bat-pad gap. Olivier clatters through it and knocks out the off stump. Bangladesh seven down
Rubel backs a long way outside leg and exposes all this stumps to this 140ks full ball. It narrowly misses the off stump
Rubel backs away outside the leg stump again, Olivier follows him from over the wicket and raps the pad
back of a length and outside off, left alone
Taijul steps away outside leg again, Olivier chases him. Fended tentatively to short leg
full and swings in a touch on off, played up to mid-on
back of a length, angling in on off, rears up at the batsman. Hits the high part of the bat and rolls to gully
back of a length and heading towards off, Liton's back-foot defensive intervenes
back of a length on off again, played back down the pitch
pitched up and outside off, driven stylishly to cover
full and in the corridor, no shot
back of a length, Rubel exposes all three stumps, but the ball bounces over off
Rubel steps away outside leg and exposes all three stumps, swishing and missing just outside off
full and angling in towards leg stump, Rubel makes room and jabs the ball down to mid-on
short and outside off. Olivier, target the stumps when Rubel backs away. He sways away in the end
full and bang on middle, Rubel stays leg-side of the ball and scoops it to cover
Rubel gets off the mark after 10 balls. Leg-stump half-volley, which is driven capably to the left of mid-on
full and holds its line just a shade outside off, Liton judges it well and lets it go
back of a length and outside off, Liton punches on the up to cover
chest-high short ball on off, Liton controls a pull wide of deep midwicket to earn a double
too full on the pads, keeps low, Liton adjusts and whips it away through backward square leg
on a length and outside off, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
back of a length on off, defended stoutly to short cover
dangled up on off, Rubel opts to defend to silly point off the front foot
overpitched on middle and leg, Rubel brings out another whippy drive and sends it to the right of mid-on
tossed up and drifts in the air, Rubel does not get close to the pitch of the ball and ekes out an inside edge onto the pad
back of a length and skids in on middle, blocked off the back foot
tossed outside off, turns away but the turn is slow, allowing him to poke it past slip
round-arm dart, Rubel keeps it out
good length and angling in on middle, chipped gently to mid-on
short and outside off, sits up, Liton picks up the length early. He rocks back and cracks a pull to the midwicket boundary. Andile doesn't have the pace to trouble Liton
full and outside off, driven off the front foot to cover
pitched up and outside off, Andile invites the drive. Liton obliges, presses forward and strokes it straight of mid-off. Parnell dives over the ball and lets it through to the boundary
too full on off, Liton pushes Andile again, this time driving exquisitely to the right of mid-on
too full and straying onto the pads, Liton simply tickles it away to the fine-leg boundary. Four boundaries off the over
pushed through on middle, dead-bat defence from Rubel

skidder on middle, Rubel jabs his bat down on it hastily. The ball bounces onto the boot and lobs to the left of silly point. Is that a clean catch from Elgar? The soft signal from umpire Dharmasena was out. Nope, not a clean catch. The ball touches the ground and then bounces back into his fingers. TV umpire Gaffaney rules it not out eventually
tossed up higher on middle stump, driven to mid-on. Mix-up between the wickets. Rubel wants the single, Liton doesn't. Rubel hares back; the throw was to the wrong end
full on the stumps, driven to mid-on
full and drifts in on middle, dead batted
floated up on the leg stump, Rubel keeps it out
full and on leg stump, bunted to short midwicket
back of a length on off, blocked off the front foot
much fuller, defended on off stump
full and straight, nudged to the right of short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, played up to cover
Rabada returns and nabs Liton. Hip-high short ball on off stump, Liton aims to pull it over square leg. Instead, he skies a top edge. Faf settles under it at second slip
length ball, pitches outside off and breaks back in, defended
defended with the turn to short leg

A big appeal for a catch in front of the wicket. Not given by umpire Dharmasena. De Kock is keen on a review. Elgar was keen as well. Faf goes for it. Pushed through quicker, starts outside off and breaks back in. Mustafiz prods at it and offers up a bat-pad catch to Markram forward short leg. There's a deflection, and Mustafiz has to go. Maharaj enters the wickets column
lobbed up on middle, dead-bat defence
skids on outside off, left alone
full on middle, stabs at it and ekes out an inside edge behind square on the leg side. Roy opens his account in Test cricket
bouncer on the leg stump, ducks under it
Rubel exposes all three stumps, the bowler follows him instead of hitting the stumps. Beaten past the outside edge
very full on middle, backs away outside leg and hacks it away to mid-on
Rubel makes room outside leg. Rabada chases him again. The batsman ducks under a bouncer outside leg
back of a length on middle, Rubel backs away outside leg and scoops it tantalisingly over Parnell at cover
back of a length and skids on off, 140ks, Rubel backs away and carves it to point
tossed up, drifts in, spins away outside off. Finds the edge but does not carry to Faf at second slip
full and outside off, tapped to the covers
tight, tight leave. Pushed through, hits the rough, and turns away. No shot
skids on off, dead batted
slow, round-arm full ball, prodded off the front foot to the left of Elgar. Too quick for him to close his hands around the ball
flatter and slides in with the arm on middle, defended
bouncer on middle, Rubel backs away and lets it pass
Rubel backs away outside leg, Rabada follows him and pings him on the glove. Rubel is in pain. He needs medical attention
Rubel jumps outside leg, Rabada chases him with a short ball, spliced to the off side
Rubel keeps backing away outside leg, Rabada keeps following him. The batsman clears his front leg and swipes it to the right of mid-on

Rabada claims a five-wicket haul - his sixth in 22 Tests - and wraps up Bangladesh for 147. Rubel backs away outside leg. This is an inch-perfect middle-stump yorker from Rabada. Bam! No shame in missing that. Even a genuine batsman would have cleaned up
short of a length and zipping through outside off, left alone
full on middle and leg, played back down the pitch
full on middle, swings away, takes the outside edge and rolls past the cordon
searing lifter, angling away outside off, Kayes arches his back and lets it sail through to the keeper
half-volley outside off, Kayes stretches out and drives it firmly to the right of mid-off, where Parnell dives over the ball
bouncer on middle, 133.4ks, slams into the gloves of de Kock as the batsman ducks under it
overpitched on the pads, flicked down to long leg for one
hurled short on leg stump, 138.2ks, Sarkar wears it on the hip. The ball lobs to short leg
full at middle stump, tapped into the pitch off the toe-end
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
first runs. Nice runs. Overpitched outside off stump, tapped past mid-off with balance
overpitched at middle stump this time, nicely controlled flick straight to short midwicket
back of a length, slanted across the corridor. Left alone
good length outside off stump, looks to drive through covers on the up. Gets it off the bottom of the bat
bouncer, slanted across the corridor. Drops the wrists and lets it pass
good length, slight shape into the pads. Nervously prods with bat and pad close, it lands in front of short leg
back of a length, angled in at off stump. Lets it go on length. Brave
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it with the bat hanging up, but that was short enough to avoid contact
back of a length, pushed down leg side. Watches it sail past

dropped. Back of a length, climbing up at his hips and he flicks it uppishly as he jumps off the ground. Markram sticks out his left hand at short leg, pulls it in towards his mid-riff but can't hold on
back of a length at the hips, anxiously shovelled down the fine leg
bouncer at off stump, a very well directed one. His bat never gets up though, and it's a good leave
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to short mid-on
short one at the ribs, gets on his toes and manages to drop this in front of short leg off the back foot
short at off stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot

taken at second slip. It's that shot again. That unambitious prod outside off stump, the nervous response on the front foot after all the anxiety on the back. This one is good length, outside off stump, and he's playing away from the body with no feet. Faf falls to his right and snaps it in front of first slip
full and angled into the toes, clipped to long leg
bouncer, angled in at off stump, nips away from the pitch and zooms past his outside edge
nearly taps it to short leg. Bouncer at middle stump, can't get on top of this entirely, but he uses soft hands to defend
good length, angled into the leg stump. Flicked uppishly to fine leg's right
full at middle stump, flicked straight to wide mid-on
sound as he looks to flick this. Taken down leg side. It was a short one climbing at his hips. They've decided not to review the not-out decision and the replays show it was thigh guard
ohhh yes. Sensational fast bowling. Short one at middle stump, climbs so quickly and so steeply at his face. He does superbly to sway away from the that. Whew.
lands on the bounce to deep square. Short one at middle stump, whips it aerially
141 kph, short one at middle stump. Looks to pull this, inside edge onto thigh guard
nicely played. Short one at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and pulls it to the deep square boundary, along the floor
good length, wide outside off stump. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to extra cover from the crease
good length, just outside off stump, left alone
good length, raps him on the pads as he looks to flick
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
short one at middle stump, under-edges the pull into short leg
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square leg
bouncer at middle stump, angled away from off stump. Looks to hook, but that's too quick for him
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
back of a length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
short at off stump, pushed to mid-off from the crease
full at off stump, pushes in front of his body, down the pitch, with no feet
short one outside off stump, gets inside the line and lets it go
oh this is mean and it strikes his helmet. Bouncer, short and flush on the front of the helmet as he looks to get under this. Deflects over the keeper. The batsman is alright.
back of a length at off stump, skewed off the outside edge through point

holes out to deep square leg. Probably instinct to go after the short one after copping one on the helmet. This cramps him at chest height and he swipes it straight to the fielder who is 15 yards in from the boundary
yorker at leg stump. Does very well to keep it out
dabs it wide of short leg as he looks to get on top of this. It's climbing at his rib cage

nearly run out after he does very well to defend this bouncer. It rises sharply from a length and he takes his bottom hand off as he fends at it. It runs wide of short leg who swivels and throws at the non-strikers end. He was short of the crease. Mid-on can't get in position to back up
top edge lands wide of fine leg and goes into the boundary. Another short one at middle stump, and he's not one to leave

misses the outside edge and the off stump by slender margins. This is full and angled away from the left-hander, who is camping on the back foot and pokes lazily at this, with both middle and off visible
dead ball. Short one at leg stump, he leaps to try and evade this. It deflects off the thigh guard and runs fine. But the umpire doesn't think he was evading
fends it off the chest past de Kock. Bouncer climbs rapidly, it's in the air as he hits it, but it's well wide of the keeper
pulls in the air but wide of deep square. No control as he takes on the bouncer
good length, angled in at off stump. Defended down the pitch

edged but wide of third slip. Back of a length in the corridor, rises on him as he looks to defend. He didn't get behind the line and it was a fend in the end. Elgar can't reach it with a dive to his right
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer, too short, too far down the leg side. A rare bad ball
inside edge onto boot. Looks to drive this full ball through the covers, but the feet aren't moving
short one at middle stump, jumps, defends
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover on the up
pulls hard, and finds the gap. Good shot. Short one doesn't climb quickly enough and he swivels to bisect fine leg and deep square
bouncer at leg stump, forces him to duck quickly. He does it well
short one at the chest, gets into the off side and lets this fly
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side with soft hands
good length, angled in at leg stump. Flicked against the turn to midwicket
full and drifted down leg, tickles it off the inside edge to fine leg's right
good length at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot

trapped on the back foot as he looks to flick. It was an arm ball that hit him on the back leg. Not out says the umpire. It appeared to be going down leg side. They've reviewed...in fact, replays show it hit the front pad first, which was further down leg. Wickets is umpire's call so the decision remains. No loss of review.
short of good length and spinning away outside off, punched to the point region
shortish, pitching outside leg and angling across the left-hander, Imrul rides the bounce and drops it in front of point

ooh, that's a nasty blow. Mushfiqur has been hit flush on the helmet. He has dropped down on his knees and has taken his helmet off. He's down in some pain clutching the side of his head. This doesn't seem good at all. It was a short ball, Mushfiqur was really tucked up and had little time to react. He ended up taking his eyes off the ball and wore it bang on the side of his head. The South African doctor rushes out to meet him as well. They need to confirm if there has been a concussion. He is back up now which is a wonderful sign. That seemed horrible. Change of helmet being called for

more of the short ball. Olivier isn't one to relent. This one's banged in halfway down but angled down the leg side which means Mushfiqur isn't quite in the firing line like the previous time. And besides, he does well this time to get well under it and does so well in time
short of good length on off, Mushfiqur is pushed back and defends down the pitch
short ball, slightly wide outside off, gets on top of the bounce and drops it down
short of good length, sees the inward angle and helps it along to forward short leg
shot. Pitched up outside off, invitingly so, and Imrul advances down the ground, gets on top of the pitch and carves it over long-off. The ball lands on the full right on the ropes
pitched up outside off, this time he just brings the front foot forward and blocks into the off side
full, outside off, defended off the front foot
this is another great shot. Full again and outside off, and he gets down to crunch a reverse sweep through backward point
fuller ball, spins in from outside off to take the inside part of the bat as he looks to push it through the off side
length, minimal turn into the batsman from outside off, defended off the backfoot
short ball, angled in, nudged through the leg side
short ball, pitches outside leg, he gets under it but the ball barely goes over his back as it doesn't climb much

has he been strangled down the leg side? De Kock goes up as do the rest of South Africa and the umpire upholds their appeal. Short of a length, looks for a tuck off the hips but Kayes gets an edge through to the keeper
short ball, angled down leg, gets under it
short ball, angled down, going over the arched back of the batsman
short ball, outside off, goes through with the pull shot early and gets beaten
pitched up outside off, comes forward and defends
full, sliding on middle and leg, blocked off the front foot
comes forward to defend this one that comes on around middle and spins away to find the outside edge. Went at it with soft hands so it doesn't carry to first slip
short, wide, shapes up for a cut and makes some room before lashing it through the point region. Beats the fielder who chases and slides forward
full around off, spinning away, defended
short of a length, not much turn, just about straightens around off but Mushfiqur makes enough room to crack a cut off the backfoot through point

now Mahmudullah has been hit on the helmet. Again, taking his eyes off the ball. Short ball, comes on dead straight to him and the ball pings the helmet and goes to the cordon where Amla tips it over. The impact wasn't as forceful this time

in the air and just short of gully. Opens the face of his bat slightly to this short of a length ball outside off and the ball goes on the bounce in front of the fielder. Needs to be careful when doing that
short of the man again. Third slip this time. Shortish ball, gets slightly big on him and finds the outside edge
short ball, going over his back as it angles down the leg side
short ball, gets big on Mushfiqur again who wears it on the glove and awkwardly keeps it down
length ball, spinning away from off, defended off the front foot
short ball, straightens outside off, mistimes a cut despite making room, to point
full on off, pushed out towards point
full, sliding on leg, pushed out with a straight bat
loopy fuller ball on middle, drilled back
extremely full on leg, squeezed out back to the bowler
short ball outside off, defended after riding the bounce
short ball outside off, jumps up and punches it through the cover and point region. Chased down and pulled back before the boundary
short ball, the bounce is too considerable to the comfort of the batsman, he has no clue how to fend it away and the ball hits the top part of the bat
short ball, swivels through with an early pull and finds the inside edge before the ball hits the back leg
short of good length, angles in, Mahmudullah stays back and defends
more of the short ball to Mahmudullah who hurriedly jumps back and keeps it down
slider on leg stump, flicks it very fine, well wide of the man at forward short leg
flighted and loopy on middle and leg, defended
full on middle and leg, driven out to mid-off
full and invitingly tossed up around middle, pushed out off the front foot
pitched up on middle and leg, defended
loopy fullish length ball outside off, mistimes as he tires to force a drive to the covers
short of a length, angled across, dabs it down with soft hands by opening the face of his bat very late
short of a length, offers up a lot of width outside off and Mahmudullah punches firmly off the backfoot through the covers
short of a length outside off, toe-ends a punch through mid-off
length ball, pushed across, left alone in the channel outside off
full, pushed across enough to make the batsman play but he doesn't
full on off,pushed wide of the man at mid-off
loopy fuller ball on middle, driven out through extra cover
length ball, sliding on leg and straightening, kept out off the backfoot
slider on leg, comes forward and defends off the inside part of the bat
full, driven to mid-off for a quick single
full, driven to the right of the fielder at cover

that's a top shot, tremendous strike from Mahmudullah. Comes charging down the track, gets on top of the bounce and meets the pitch before lofting him inside-out over extra cover. Sublime balance and superb timing
fullish, angled across the off-stump of Mushfiqur who is sure of it and lets it go
fullish, pitching just around off and nipping away late, Mushfiqur shoulders arms
full, pushed across a long way, not going to make him play with that line

error in judgement from Mushfiqur. Lets one go but has worn it on the pad. Top delivery from Parnell, though. Mushfiqur wasn't entirely wrong in letting it go. Like the previous deliveries, this one's angled across. Pitches on a length around middle and leg. Mushfiqur plants the front foot across and lifts his bat but the ball nips in ever-so-slightly very late to hit the pad. Mushfiqur opts for a review. Replays show that the impact is in line and the ball would have just about clipped off stump so the umpire's call remains
full at middle stump, head falls over into the off side as he flicks against the angle to get it wide of mid-on
full and swinging away from off stump, feet barely move as he skews this off the outside edge through point
good length, swinging away from off stump, leans in and caresses this gracefully through the covers
back of a length, swinging away from outside off stump. Squares him up, defended off the outside half of the bat
full and wide outside off stump, left alone. More signs of swing
full at off stump, tapped down the pitch at the bowler
full at off stump, wobbles away a bit. Mistimed push down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
overpitched outside off stump, driven to extra cover
good length, swings away from off stump. Thick outside edge, stopped by a leaping Bavuma at gully
overpitched outside off stump, drilled through the covers
good length at leg stump, flicked to deeps square
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
back of a length, shapes in towards the corridor. Nearly chops this onto the stumps as he looks to cut
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
full outside off stump, drives firmly, straight to extra cover
good length, swinging away from outside off, driven on the up to short cover
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
back of a length, angled into the hips and helped along, aerially, to the long leg boundary
full and wide outside off stump, reaches out and slaps it past cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
oh lovely. Overpitched wide outside off stump, right under his eyes and he works the wrists to find the gap between point and cover
good length, tailing away from the corridor. Confidently driven to mid-off on the up
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
full and wide outside off, waits for it to come to him and opens the face to guide it through backward point
short and wide outside off stump, chopped straight to backward point
back of a length, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, shapes in and straightens. Retreats after thinking of pushing at it
full outside off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, swings away late, but left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone
overpitched at off stump, late shape away as he drives. Hits it in the air but it falls short of extra cover
glorious shot! Full and wide outside off stump, extends his arms and hits this late through the covers
back of a length, angled into the pads. Flicked to deep square
overpitched on the pads, leans into it and flicks uppishly to the midwicket boundary
overpitched outside off stump, jams it wide of mid-off
good length, angled into the pads. Defended into the leg side
good length, swinging away from outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
good length, wide outside off stump, left alone
slogged it to the midwicket boundary from outside off. Length outside off, swipes across the line and drags it off the inside half of the bat
back of a length outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off stump, chopped to deep point
back of a length at off stump, shape away, left alone

back of a length and sliding in at leg stump. Hits him on the pad and it also lobs to short leg who takes it. Umpire says not out on the lbw...they've reviewed. It hit him high on the pad and was only clipping leg stump. So that remains umpire's call. And there was no edge, so he's not caught either. Review retained.
short one, rises up at his shoulder and he gets it out of the way
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length outside off, leans in to poke it through the covers
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length, slight shape away from off stump, pushed to midwicket with a closed face
overpitched, angled in at off stump. Tapped to mid-on
good length, in the corridor. Left alone
back of a length, just outside off stump, left alone
back of a length, in the corridor, shaping away, left alone

shoulders arms and loses off stump. He took it away from the corridor for quite a while and Liton was happy to leave. But this one is angled in and hits the top of off stump. Well set up from the seamer
good length, angled into leg stump. Pushed to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
full and wide outside off and he brings out yet another cover drive and executes it perfectly
back of a length, shape away from off stump, defended off the outside half
back of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length, straightens in the corridor and gets the outside edge to gully along the floor

big dive to the left from Elgar at gully and that is Rabada's 100th Test wicket. Back of a length and wide outside off. It rises off the pitch as he shapes to drive it off the back foot and in the end he's forced to reach out with hard hands. Slices it and Elgar gets both hands as he flies to the left
good length, shapes away from off stump. Tempts him into going after that, but he changes his mind last moment
good length, moving away outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
full and into the pads, flicked confidently. Was aerial for a while but wide of midwicket
beaten on the outside edge as this leaves him late. Leans in to try and reach out for this
good length outside off, left alone
short one, down leg side, evades him as he ducks awkwardly
yorker at off stump, watchfully pushed back at the bowler
length ball, slanted away from off stump, left alone
bouncer at leg stump, and he's not concerned with anything other than getting his head out of the way. Bat and gloves hanging high
good length outside off stump, looks to leave, but late on the decision. It hits the toe of the bat and dribbles through the covers
good length, angled into middle stump, defended to mid-on
good length, angled into middle stump. Tapped to mid-on
top edge lands wide of deep square. Short one climbs at his chest, cramped on the hook. Gets under it too much
full and swinging away from off stump, driven to mid-off
overpitched outside off, driven off the toe-end, to extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up

taken at second slip. Good, disciplined bowling. Back of a length in the corridor, late movement away and he pokes at it. Nice healthy edge, a bit of a stretch for Faf at slip, but all too easy in the end
back of a length outside off, poked to extra cover off the toe-end
leg stump out of the floor and out for a spin! Back of a length outside off stump, stabs at it away from the body, half looking to get out of the line. Big inside edge onto leg stump
outside edge lands short of gully. Backs away in fear, stabs at this full ball outside off and gets an edge
bouncer at middle stump, looks down into the floor instead of ducking. Danger averted
yorker at off stump, walks into the leg side and somehow manages to keep it out

he'll remember this day for it is the day he managed to get a boundary off Rabada's bowling. Backs away as Rabada is about to release and gets followed with a yorker. Plonks the bat down and inside edges to the fine leg boundary
good length, pitches on off stump, nips away and beats the outside edge
good length at off stump, and he somehow manages to look solid as he defends despite middle and off visible
good length at off stump, swings away from off stump, takes the outside edge as he looks to defend
full and into leg sump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
good length outside off stump, shape away, hit wide of mid-off with the toe-end of the bat
full and into the leg side, flicked to fine leg's left
full at off stump, exposes the stumps and jams it into the pitch
yorker at middle stump and eventually one would sneak through. Smashes the stumps as he looks to slice it. That's ten wickets in the match for Rabada
short at middle stump, backs away to try and slice it over the cordon. Beaten
bouncer above the stumps, backs away to play the cut, beaten
back of a length at leg stump, bunts it towards short leg
short outside off, backs away, lifts it over the slips and manages to make this land between two catching third man fielders
back of a length, angled into the corridor from around the wicket. Looks to cut, beaten on the inside edge
back of a length at off stump, looks to cut, gets an inside edge towards the slips
short and wide outside off, makes room and looks to slap it through the covers. Beaten
overpitched outside off stump, tapped to extra cover
wow! Steps down the track, meets this at the pitch outside off and sends it rocketing over the long-off boundary!

yorker at his toe, he can't get bat on it. It deflects into the cordon. He's looking at the umpire as South Africa appeal for lbw and isn't aware a slip fielder has taken aim. The stumps are it. The third umpire is summoned, but he's just managed to get his heel down
short and wide outside off, backs away, slaps it through backward point
short at off stump, backs away, under-edges it into the point region
bouncer at off stump, backs away, tries to...cut? Hook? Not sure. It flies over slip anyway
short and wide outside off, cut to point
bouncer at middle stump, backs away, lets it go
full at off stump, pushed down the pitch
short at off stump, steps out and looks to slap it through midwicket. Toe-ends it into the turf and towards mid-on
full toss wide outside off, looks to slap it through the covers, inside edge into his back toe
dropped. Short and wide outside off, backs away and tries to cut through the covers. Drags it back at the bowler off the toe of the bat, and puts it down
offcutter, back of a length at leg stump, backs away, defended off the back foot
bowled. Goes full and straight, Mustafizur looks to swiped it over midwicket and misses. Leg stump thumped comprehensively
